message:
as mentioned in this topic the new browser for windows 10
- Powered by a new rendering engine
- loads the IE11 engine for legacy enterprise web sites when needed
- standards support and roadmap can be found at http://status.modern.ie.
story: Mohamed Hashem shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Project Spartan and the Windows 10 January Preview Build - IEBlog - Site Home - MSDN Blogs
caption: blogs.msdn.com
description: Yesterday, we announced that Windows 10 will ship with a brand new browser, codenamed “Project Spartan.” Designed for Windows 10, Spartan provides a more interoperable, reliable, and discoverable experience with advanced features including the ability to annotate on web pages, a distraction-free rea…

data.message: "Polish a turd its still a turd" :D

i think this version should be somehow better than the other 
- many people would try to use it 
-the browser is somehow related to bing search so free product advertisement and so on 
-so that i think they should investment in this version ( to be more specific there more improvement from ie10 but not better enough in anyway ) and we are not talking about revolutionary change there but better enough to stay 1 day before install another browser not the first thing to do after windows setup - for me i just need ui imrovement - performance enhancement -memoery managemet and not crash for open 15 tabs not more :D and implement features like any modern browser  in any way there a beta version in win 10 jan. build to try and there a light version to test only in win 8.1 in modern.ie
